angle.headline: The Volatility Index: QB Pressure Splits Decoded
angle.angle: The market treats the 49ers QB as a constant. The data shows he is a variable dependent entirely on pocket integrity. With a 112.4 rating clean vs 64.2 under pressure, and an opponent boasting a 34% pressure rate, the 'Under Passing Yards' is the sharpest play on the board.

specific_facts: Clean Pocket Passer Rating: 112.4 (Rank #3 in NFL).
Under Pressure Passer Rating: 64.2 (Rank #24 in NFL).
Opponent Defense Pressure Rate: 34.1% (Rank #4 in NFL).
75% of the QB's interceptions this season occurred when the pocket was collapsed.
Opponent generates pressure without blitzing on 28% of dropbacks.
sources_to_cite: NFL Next Gen Stats (Time to Throw vs Time to Pressure)
Sharp Football Analysis (Warren Sharp's pressure splits)
key_quotes_stats: "The cliff isn't a slope, it's a drop-off. He becomes a different quarterback when the pocket collapses."
"The spread assumes the 'Clean Pocket' version shows up. The matchup dictates the 'Under Pressure' version."
"64.2 Rating under pressure is lower than the league average for backups."
counter_arguments_to_address: "He gets the ball out fast." (Rebuttal: His average time to throw is 2.72s; the opponent's average time to pressure is 2.48s).
"They use max protect." (Rebuttal: Max protect reduces eligible receivers to 2 or 3, allowing the defense to bracket coverage and hold the ball longer).
